referralLink.title: Driving knowledge Test Simulation
referralLink.description: Are you ready for DKT test? Try simulation test before you go for final test.

referralLink.title: NSW Government Website for DKT
referralLink.description: Government website for all informationunder one umbrella.

questions.qn: What will happen if you are caught cheating on the knowledge test?
options: You will never be allowed to take another test
Nothing, there is no penalty
You will not be allowed to take another test for 6 weeks

questions.qn: What will happen if you offer a testing officer a bribe to pass your driving test?
options: Action will be taken against you. The penalties are severe and include fines and imprisonment.
Only the testing officer will be investigated.
Nothing, there is no penalty

questions.qn: What will happen if a testing officer asks you for a bribe to pass your driving test and you give it to him or her?
options: Action will be taken against all involved. The penalties are severe and include fines and imprisonment.
Nothing, there is no penalty.
Only the testing officer will be investigated.

questions.qn: Can a P1 or P2 provisional driver legally instruct a learner driver?
options: Yes, provided the provisional driver has held a P2 licence for more than 6 months
Yes, provided L and P1 or P2 plates are displayed
No

questions.qn: To progress to a P2 provisional licence, a P1 provisional driver must hold a P1 licence for a minimum period of -
options: 18 months
12 months
10 months
24 months

questions.qn: If one or two of your wheels run off the edge of the roadway, you should -
options: Increase your speed and drive back on the road
Slow down quickly by braking hard.
Slow down gradually and ease back onto the road.

questions.qn: If there are no lanes marked on the road, you should drive -
options: Anywhere on your side of the road.
Near to the left-hand side of the road.
Along the middle of the road.

questions.qn: How close can you park to another vehicle when parked parallel to the kerb?
options: Yes, if not obstructing traffic
Yes, if delivering goods.
No, not at any time.

questions.qn: Do you have any responsibilities when opening a vehicle door on a roadway?
options: No, any following traffic must stop if the door interferes with its progress
Yes, you must not open a door if you are likely to cause danger to road users or impede traffic.
No, there is no regulation to cover this situation.

questions.qn: Are you permitted to park on a median strip or traffic island?
options: Yes, but for no more than 30 minutes
Yes, in daylight hours
No, not at any time.

questions.qn: When driving at sunset or dawn on a dark day, what should you do?
options: Turn on your lights on low beam.
Keep your sunglasses on to cut down headlight glare.
Turn on your hazard warning lights

questions.qn: Is it an offence to obstruct clear vision of your number plates?
options: No, you are allowed to cover your number plates if you want to.
Yes, but it is legal for a towbar or bicycle rack to cover the rear number plate.
Yes, at any time.

questions.qn: You are driving at night with your headlights on high beam. When should you dip your headlights?
options: When within 200 metres of an oncoming vehicle only.
When within 200 metres of the vehicle ahead or an oncoming one.
Never, you are allowed to drive with your lights on high beam at all times.

questions.qn: Before driving on a freeway, which of the following should you do?
options: Take something to calm your nerves before driving.
Make sure your vehicle has enough fuel, oil, water and the correct tyre pressure.
Take your street directory in case you get lost.

questions.qn: What must you do if you miss your exit on a freeway?
options: Continue until you reach the next appropriate exit.
Stop, and reverse back along the freeway to the exit you missed
Stop immediately and turn around.

questions.qn: As you leave a freeway, which of the following should you check?
options: Fuel gauge.
Your speed.
Windscreen wipers.

questions.qn: Are you permitted to drive a car towing more than one trailer?
options: Yes, provided you have held a licence for two years.
Yes, if the combined length of vehicle and trailers does not exceed 15 metres.
No, not at all.

questions.qn: What must you do when you are towing a caravan to help other vehicles overtake?
options: Keep at least 60 metres behind heavy vehicles or other vehicles towing caravans.
Drive at least 25 km/h below the speed limit.
Stop immediately and let the faster vehicle overtake.

questions.qn: Are you permitted to tow a caravan with a person riding in the caravan?
options: Make sure you have a street directory, so you know where you are going.
Check your tyre pressure, and if necessary, increase it to what the manufacturer recommends.
Have a large meal and a cup of coffee

questions.qn: If an oncoming vehicle crosses the centre line and is coming straight at you and you cannot stop, you should -
options: Drive onto the wrong side of the road and hope the other vehicle does not do the same.
Slow down and hope that the driver will turn away.
Brake, look for room to the left, sound your horn and flash your lights.
